title: Monster Hunter 2 Wiki | Bestiary
description: In-game descriptions and brief notes for the all monsters. Some monsters are so mysterious, little is known about them.
head: <link rel='stylesheet' href='../css/bestiary.css'/><link rel='stylesheet' href='css/bestiary.css'/>
subtitle: In-game descriptions and brief notes for the all monsters. Some monsters are so mysterious, little is known about them.

monsters.name: Felyne
monsters.description: Cat-like humanoids with white fur. Normally quiet unless angered, in which case they attack. Capable of speech. Found in the employ of humans. <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Melynx
monsters.description: Cat-like humanoids with black fur. Sticky-fingered, they won't pass up a chance to steal and take it to their village. Distracted by Felvine. <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Shakalaka
monsters.description: A small, four-limbed monster known for always wearing a mask. Their camouflage-like qualities make them difficult to spot, but if you do, you're in trouble! Their leader, the King Shakalaka, is known to wear a crown like object. <sub>[Monster Hunter Freedom 2]</sub>

monsters.name: King Shakalaka
monsters.description: This Shakalaka chieftain pulls together the Shakalaka's as one, in order to act. Extremely quick to anger when approached, this hot-head can invoke his fiery wrath with emotion alone. Feared by even the most skilled hunters. <sub>[Monster Hunter Freedom Unite]</sub>

monsters.name: Vespoid
monsters.description: Enormous, wasp-like insectoid with a stinger that stuns prey. There are rarely any usable materials left to harvest from them once killed. <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Hornetaur
monsters.description: Vespoid-like monster with a thicker shell. Rarely any usable materials are left to harvest once they are killed. But if you could sap their Health gradually... <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Great Thunderbug
monsters.description: An abnormally large Thunderbug raised inside the body of an elder dragon and known to inhabit the same areas as its former host, its electrical attack is deadly. This bug has various uses as material for crafting weapons and items. <sub>[Monster Hunter Freedom 2]</sub>

monsters.name: Kelbi
monsters.description: A herbivorous, deer-like monster. Valued for their horns, they run away at the first hint of danger. Hunted for their chewy but flavorful meat. <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Mosswine
monsters.description: Wild pigs covered in moss and fungus. Sometimes you will even find mushrooms growing on them. Their meat is known as a delicacy. Though normally docile, they will charge you if angered! <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Anteka
monsters.description: Herbivorous monsters living in the snowy mountains. Normally docile, but when provoked it will attack with its giant antlers. Its high quality pelt has many uses and its antlers are highly valued by the Guild. <sub>[Monster Hunter Freedom 2]</sub>

monsters.name: Popo
monsters.description: A herbivorous monster known for its giant, bent fangs. Living in herds, it is particularly bold when defending its offspring. Popo meat is quite nutritious, and its tongue is widely admired as a delicacy. <sub>[Monster Hunter Freedom 2]</sub>

monsters.name: Aptonoth
monsters.description: Hunted as a food source, these creatures are preyed upon by both hunter and monster alike. Usually timid, but in packs they defend themselves with surprising strength. <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Apceros
monsters.description: Hunted for their meat, which is buried under a thick, armored hide. Aggressive, hunting them can be a challenge. Its eggs are a valuable guild commodity. <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Velociprey
monsters.description: Aggressive, carnivorous monsters that travel in packs. Even master hunters should avoid getting surrounded! Wide ranging, they are found in many different climates. <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: White Velociprey
monsters.description: A species very similar to, and often found in the company of, Velociprey. Their white skin is beautiful, but their temperament is not. Much like their blue cousins, they attack in deadly packs. <sub>[Monster Hunter Freedom 2]</sub>

monsters.name: Velocidrome
monsters.description: The alpha monster that leads a Velociprey pack. Larger and with a more prominent crest. Highly territorial, but will retreat to a safe place when injured. <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Genprey
monsters.description: Subspecies of Velociprey mainly found in deserts. They travel in packs. Their large fangs and claws contain a neurotoxin that is used to stun and paralyze prey. <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Gendrome
monsters.description: The alpha monster that leads a Genprey pack. They are larger and have a more prominent crest. Found in the desert. They can paralyze prey using their toxic fangs and claws. <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Ioprey
monsters.description: A subspecies of Velociprey often found in subtropical zones. Sacs in their throat contain a powerful poison that slowly drains the Health of their prey. <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Iodrome
monsters.description: Alpha monster of an Ioprey pack. Larger and with a more prominent crest. Found in tropical zones. Their poison saps the life force of its prey. <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Yian Kut-Ku
monsters.description: A bird-like wyvern with a huge beak and large ears. With its sensitive hearing it dislikes loud noises. Smaller but faster than other wyverns. <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Blue Yian Kut-Ku
monsters.description: A Yian Kut-Ku variant protected by a blue carapace. They share the same weakness to loud noises that ordinary Yian Kut-Ku have, but when angered, they display significantly greater physical strength. <sub>[Monster Hunter 4U]</sub>

monsters.name: Yian Garuga
monsters.description: A breed of Yian Kut-Ku with a hard black shell and a long mane. Known for its trap avoiding slyness and poison loaded tail, it is a particularly evil wyvern, so beware! <sub>[Monster Hunter Freedom 2]</sub>

monsters.name: Gypceros
monsters.description: A wyvern that can generate bright flashes of light with its prominent head crest. Its rubbery hide resists damage, and it can spit a poisonous substance. <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]

monsters.name: Purple Gypceros
monsters.description: A Gypceros variant distinguished by its unique purple hide. They are extremely resistant to poison, and can spit copious amounts of highly venomous saliva. <sub>[Monster Hunter 4U]</sub>

monsters.name: Remobra
monsters.description: Small wyverns with outstanding flying abilities, they loiter in the skies waiting to prey upon weakened animals. Known to attack alongside Elder Dragons, they are known as an omen to disaster. <sub>[Monster Hunter Freedom 2]</sub>

monsters.name: Rathian
monsters.description: Female wyvern to the male Rathalos. Unlike its male counterpart, it usually patrols its territory by foot. Its tail spikes are filled with poison. <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Pink Rathian
monsters.description: A subspecies of Rathian with vibrant pink scales. Pink Rathian wield their toxic tails more skillfully than normal Rathian, using a wide variety of attacks to weaken their prey before eventually moving in for the kill. <sub>[Monster Hunter 3U]</sub>

monsters.name: Gold Rathian
monsters.description: A rare variant of Rathian with a beautiful golden body reminiscent of the moon. Little is known about their behavior or physiology--including the source of their rich golden sheen. <sub>[Monster Hunter 3U]</sub>

monsters.name: Rathalos
monsters.description: Male wyvern that keeps a nest and patrols its territory from the air in search of prey. Its claws are filled with poison that weakens its prey. <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Azure Rathalos
monsters.description: An azure-colored subspecies of Rathalos. More mobile than their standard cousin, they locate prey from the air and quickly swoop in for the kill. Once these master hunters select a target, there is little hope of escape. <sub>[Monster Hunter 3U]</sub>

monsters.name: Silver Rathalos
monsters.description: A rare variant of Rathalos with a beautiful silver body reminiscent of the sun. Little is known about their behavior or physiology--including the source of their rich silver sheen. <sub>[Monster Hunter 3U]</sub>

monsters.name: Khezu
monsters.description: Loathsome wyverns that live inside caves. Near blind, they detect their prey by smell. They are capable of generating electric shocks, which they use to paralyze their prey. <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>
monsters.hitzoneNotes: Stagger the stomach, head, and each leg twice each to break the skin.

monsters.name: Red Khezu
monsters.description: A ghastly Khezu variant with a crimson hue and a much more aggressive temperament. Their electrical organs are further developed as well, giving them a wider variety of attacks to disable and ensnare prey. <sub>[Monster Hunter 4U]</sub>
monsters.hitzoneNotes: Stagger the stomach, head, and each leg twice each to break the skin.

monsters.name: Basarios
monsters.description: A large wyvern found in volcanic zones. They are the juvenile form of the Gravios. They have a steel-like carapace that requires powerful weapons to crack. Emits poison gas. <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Gravios
monsters.description: A large wyvern found in volcanic zones. It possesses a fiery breath-attack and can emit a sleeping gas. Their scales are extremely hard, deflecting most weapon attacks. <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Black Gravios
monsters.description: A Gravios subspecies distinguished by a hard black carapace that allows them to contain their own extraordinarily high internal temperatures. They sometimes discharge this thermal energy as an extremely powerful heat ray. <sub>[Monster Hunter 4U]</sub>

monsters.name: Monoblos
monsters.description: Large-horned wyvern found in deserts. The giant horn makes their attacks very dangerous. Without breath attack. Their ear-splitting roar is the bane of hunters. <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: White Monoblos
monsters.description: A rare Monoblos subspecies covered in chalk-tinted plating. More ferocious than its standard cousin, the White Monoblos is unrelenting in the pursuit of any prey it happens upon. <sub>[Monster Hunter 4U]</sub>

monsters.name: Diablos
monsters.description: A two-horned wyvern found in deserts. They are capable of burrowing into the sand to attack prey from below. It's confirmed that they have a subspecies called Monoblos. <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Black Diablos
monsters.description: These black-shelled Diablos are treated as a subspecies, but are actually just normal female Diablos in heat. The color change is a warning to other creatures, as they tend to become extremely aggressive during mating season. <sub>[Monster Hunter 3U]</sub>

monsters.name: Cephalos
monsters.description: Wyverns found only in the desert. They resemble a Plesioth, but live and “swim” in sand rather than water. They seldom appear above land, but when their hearing is disturbed... <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Cephadrome
monsters.description: The alpha monster form of the Cephalos. Larger and armored with black scales, they fit the appearance of a leader perfectly. Their fins hold a paralyzing toxin. <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Plesioth
monsters.description: An enormous, flightless, aquatic wyvern with wings that have evolved into fins for swimming. Although superficially fish-like, they can move on land as well. They love frogs. <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Green Plesioth
monsters.description: A subspecies of Plesioth with jade-green scales. Though primarily aquatic, the creature's movements are equally adept both in and out of water. When enraged, it has a habit of surfacing to rampage on land. <sub>[Monster Hunter 3U]</sub>

monsters.name: Hermitaur
monsters.description: A small Carapaceon with an incredibly hard shell. Known to live in great numbers in the desert, or lurking underground, one must be careful when treading in its domain. Its brains are said to be a true delicacy. <sub>[Monster Hunter Freedom 2]</sub>

monsters.name: Daimyo Hermitaur
monsters.description: A large Carapaceon with a giant monster's skull on its back. Fond of the sand, it is mainly seen in the desert or jungle zones. Living underground, it surfaces when hungering for a snack. <sub>[Monster Hunter Freedom 2]</sub>

monsters.name: Ceanataur
monsters.description: An adolescent Carapaceon with an organic shell firmly placed on its back. Once grown, this shell will be replaced by a giant monster's skull. Mainly living in volcanic zones, it is very aggressive, and not to be underestimated. <sub>[Monster Hunter Freedom 2]</sub>

monsters.name: Shogun Ceanataur
monsters.description: A large Carapaceon with a giant monster's skull on its back. Its long, sharp pincers allow it to pierce volcanic bedrock and travel along ceilings. Sometimes, a precious and valuable pearl can be found inside its shell. <sub>[Monster Hunter Freedom 2]</sub>

monsters.name: Shen Gaoren
monsters.description: A giant Carapaceon with an equally giant monster's skull on its back. Prone to roaming and fiercely territorial, any intruders will be met with opposition, so nearby forts or towns must be warned of its presence. <sub>[Monster Hunter Freedom 2]</sub>
monsters.hitzoneNotes: Claws can only be broken after staggering each of its four legs twice.

sources.name: Claws
sources.require: Stagger each leg twice, then break

monsters.name: Bullfango
monsters.description: A large wild boar. Foul tempered, they will charge hunters on sight. Aggressive and powerful, so beware! Often hunted for their meat, which many hunters find delicious. <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Bulldrome
monsters.description: The powerful leader of the wild boars known for its enormous tusks. More aggressive than a Bullfango, it is known to rush into a fight, and is extremely proficient at locating a foe. <sub>[Monster Hunter Freedom 2]</sub>

monsters.name: Conga
monsters.description: Fanged, ape-like Primatius with pink fur. Prefers to live in small groups as opposed to large packs, and particularly enjoys mushroom snacks. If stumbled upon, it will be hostile, so beware of areas like the swamp or jungle. <sub>[Monster Hunter Freedom 2]</sub>

monsters.name: Congalala
monsters.description: A large Pelagus sporting pink fur often spotted in the jungle and swamp zones. Fond of mushrooms, its diet affects its breath, which may be poisonous or flaming. One can predict these traits via the food in its local habitat. <sub>[Monster Hunter Freedom 2]</sub>

monsters.name: Blango
monsters.description: A Primatius covered entirely in white fur. Known to move in packs and led by a Blangonga. The Blangonga exerts tight control over the group, and any call to gather will be met immediately by the rank and file Blangos. <sub>[Monster Hunter Freedom 2]</sub>

monsters.name: Blangonga
monsters.description: Leader of a Blango pack, it is twice as large and recognized by its giant fangs, whiskers, and head-crown. It sends its pack to attack any trespassers. Its jumping power allows it great mobility in its home range of the snowy mountains. <sub>[Monster Hunter Freedom 2]</sub>
monsters.hitzoneNotes: Fire element damage is required to break Blangonga's fangs.

monsters.name: Rajang
monsters.description: Ultra-aggressive creature that is rarely sighted and seldom survived. Survivors report it exhibits a strange attack. The Rajang is said to be a loner, and this isolated life has made it difficult to pin down its territorial leanings. <sub>[Monster Hunter Freedom 2]</sub>
monsters.hitzoneNotes: Ice element damage is required to break Rajang's tail, and the final blow must land while it's enraged.

monsters.name: Kirin
monsters.description: Said to glow a faint blue. Few have seen it so details are scarce. It's apparently capable of calling forth lightning at will. Its material is very valuable. <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Kushala Daora
monsters.description: A metal plated dragon known as the tempest of wind. Eyewitnesses report violent storms alongside the dragon, and its wide range means towns may be attacked. <sub>[Monster Hunter Freedom 2]</sub>

monsters.name: Kushala Daora (Rusted)
monsters.description: A Kushala Daora whose scales have rusted. This rusted exoskeleton must soon be shed, and makes the dragon quick to rage. <sub>[Monster Hunter Online]</sub>

monsters.name: Chameleos
monsters.description: Eyewitness sightings of this Elder Dragon are extremely rare due to its ability to literally vanish; however, details of this are unclear. It is thought that shocking it may make it reappear, but this is unproven. <sub>[Monster Hunter Freedom 2]</sub>
monsters.hitzoneNotes: Dragon element damage is required to break Chameleos's horn.

monsters.name: Lunastra
monsters.description: A brutal female Elder Dragon with breath of flame and expert control over fire. It is said that this control comes from the crown-like horns on its head, but this has not been confirmed. <sub>[Monster Hunter Freedom 2]</sub>
monsters.hitzoneNotes: Dragon element damage is required to break Lunastra's horns, and its health must be below 60%. Lunastra's tail can only be cut when it's below 40% health.

monsters.name: Teostra
monsters.description: A brutal male Elder Dragon with breath of flame and expert control over fire. Its vile temperament means anyone who approaches is subject to fire and brimstone. Known to attack towns, the Guild keeps tabs on its movements. <sub>[Monster Hunter Freedom 2]</sub>
monsters.hitzoneNotes: Dragon element damage is required to break Teostra's horns, and its health must be below 60%. Teostra's tail can only be broken when it's below 40% health.

monsters.name: Lao-Shan Lung
monsters.description: A giant dragon few have seen and lived to tell the tale. When on a rampage it wreaks havoc on all in its path. The guild has built a fortress to repel the beast. Will it hold? <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Ashen Lao-Shan Lung
monsters.description: This subspecies of Lao-Shan Lung characterized by a bluish shell. The color of its shell is determined by the minerals it takes in while its shell is forming. This subspecies incorporates harder minerals, and is also known as the rocky mountain dragon. <sub>[Monster Hunter Frontier]</sub>

monsters.name: Yama Tsukami
monsters.description: An Elder Dragon that floats through the sky. A bite of earth, a drink of forest, it's a veritable god of the sky made of the richest soil. Ancient trees grow thick on its back like on a mountain. It's rumored to live near a forlorn, remote tower. <sub>[Monster Hunter Freedom Unite]</sub>

monsters.name: Yama Tsukami (unused)
monsters.description: apparently unused

monsters.name: Fatalis
monsters.description: A legendary black dragon said to have prowled these lands from the days of old. A monster shrouded in mystery... <sub>[Monster Hunter (US)]</sub>

monsters.name: Crimson Fatalis
monsters.description: It is said that this is an especially old Fatalis whose scales have turned red from years of exposure to volcanic heat. <sub>[no known sources]</sub>

monsters.name: White Fatalis
monsters.description: Guild researchers surmise that this is an especially ancient Fatalis. <sub>[no known sources]</sub>
